title: Closing Bell: Sensex settles 550 points lower from day's high; Nifty ends below 25,700; metals, FMCG drag
author: Rakesh Patil
content:
See the top gainers, losers, invest and get updated what's happening in the crypto market

Discover the secret world of unlisted shares — analyse India's top pre-IPO companies and invest before they hit the markets

Closing Bell:Equity benchmarks inched higher on January 16 to end the week little changed as earnings optimism in IT and PSU banks provided some support, but concerns around a US trade deal and persistent foreign fund outflows kept up the pressure.

Smallcap shares that recovered today

NIFTY Smallcap 100 Recovery from Day's Low

Sterling and Wilson shares rise 6% on Q3 revenue rise

Shares of renewables company Sterling and Wilson jumped 6% to Rs 210 apiece as the company recorded profit of Rs 26 crore in Q3 versus Rs 14-crore loss last year; revenue from operations rose 14%.

Midcap stocks that touched 52-week high today

Tata Steel tops Nifty 50 this week on mining case relief, metals rally

Tata Steel jumped 6.3% to Rs 188.6 apiece for the week, top gainer on Nifty 50 index. Stock reaps benefits of rally in metals prices as well as court relief in mining dispute.

Stock rose 2.7% on Monday, snapping 3-day losing streak, after company said Orissa High Court extended interim relief in chromite mining dispute.

Kernex Microsystems jumps 8% on Rs 2,460-cr order win

Shares of Kernex Microsystems jumped 8% to 1,357.8 apiece as railway tech firm said on Thursday it won order worth Rs 2,460-crore from Chittaranjan Locomotive Works

Order is for supply, installation, testing and commissioning of on-board Kavach loco equipment sets. Stock fell about 9.5% in 2025, first annual loss in 4 years

Markets Today | Nifty 100 losers led by pharma, metals and defensives

Selling pressure intensified in several heavyweight stocks within the Nifty 100 in intraday trade. Eternal topped the losers’ list, sliding nearly 3 percent on heavy volumes. Pharma stocks also remained under pressure, with Cipla and Sun Pharma both falling over 2 percent. Metal stocks added to the drag, as Hindustan Zinc and Hindalco Industries declined sharply. Weakness was also seen in Bharat Electronics, Avenue Supermarts, and Maruti Suzuki, while Jio Financial Services also traded lower, adding to the pressure on the index.

Markets Today | NSE largecap losers today

NIFTY 100 Top Stock Losers (Intra-day)CompanyCMPChg(%)VolumeEternal290.50-2.9245.96mCipla1,396.10-2.683.33mBharat Elec406.65-2.6212.39mHind Zinc637.85-2.58.64mHindalco931.60-2.492.68mCG Power563.65-2.31.65mAvenue Supermar3,744.30-2.25514.09kSun Pharma1,662.90-2.222.37mMaruti Suzuki15,802.00-2.17465.81kJio Financial280.95-2.1113.19m

Markets Today | Amagi Media Labs IPO subscribed 10x on Day 3 so far

The IPO of Amagi Media Labs is set to close for public bidding later today, January 16. The maiden public issue of the company has been subscribed more than 10 times its offer size on Day 3 so far, amid a sharp surge in investor interest seen during the mid-day hours.

Retail Individual Investors (RII) subscribed their reserved portion 4.43 times (443 percent).Non Institutional Investors (NII) led, subscribing their reserved portion nearly 19 times (1,897 percent) so far.Qualified Institutional Buyers (QIB) have booked the portion kept for them over 8 times (811 percent).

Markets Today | IT stocks dominate Nifty largecap gainers

IT stocks led the gains within the Nifty 100 in intraday trade, reinforcing the sector’s leadership through the session. Infosys rose over 5 percent on strong volumes, followed by Tech Mahindra and LTIMindtree, both gaining close to 5 percent. Wipro and HCL Technologies also featured among the top gainers. Outside IT, buying interest was seen in select financials and cyclicals, with Punjab National Bank and Shriram Finance posting solid gains, while Bharat Petroleum and Samvardhana Motherson also traded higher.

Markets Today | NSE largecap gainers today

NIFTY 100 Top Stock Gainers (Intra-day)CompanyCMPChg(%)VolumeInfosys1,681.005.0815.64mTech Mahindra1,662.704.672.54mLTIMindtree6,311.004.65727.11kWipro267.852.948.86mPNB131.572.2526.98mShriram Finance1,001.302.069.70mMOTHERSON115.581.799.36mTMPV355.751.77.50mBPCL362.651.614.01mHCL Tech1,693.601.52.05m

Markets Today | HPCL, BPCL, IOC shares jump up to 4% as oil prices decline

The shares of oil marketing companies (OMC) jumped in trade on January 16 as oil prices extended decline after US President Donald Trump signaled that he may hold off on attacking Iran for now. Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Limited (HPCL) shares surged nearly 4 percent to trade at Rs 456.50 apiece, snapping a two-session losing streak.Read More

Markets Today | BSE sectoral indices mixed; IT bucks the trend

Sectoral performance on the BSE remained uneven in late trade, with IT stocks standing out as the sole pocket of strength. The BSE IT index jumped 3.17 percent to 37,694, extending recent gains, even as it remained sharply lower on a one-year basis. Most other sectors traded under pressure. BSE Capital Goods slipped 1.43 percent, while BSE Consumer Durables fell 1.4 percent and BSE Healthcare declined 1.16 percent. Auto, FMCG and power stocks also remained weak, reflecting broad-based profit-taking. BSE Metal eased 0.76 percent despite strong longer-term gains, while BSE Realty and BSE Oil & Gas traded marginally higher.

Markets Today | BSE sectoral indices performance

BSE Indian Indices PerformanceIndexCMPChg(%)YTD(%)1 Week(%)1 Month(%)1 Year(%)BSE Auto61237.07-0.57-2.11-1.690.0018.58BSE Cap Goods63820.42-1.43-4.90-2.69-4.20-0.53BSE FMCG19088.41-0.24-6.18-0.51-5.16-5.29BSE Metal38168.43-0.763.694.2610.1035.01BSE Oil & Gas27656.750.09-3.661.44-0.717.26BSE Realty6640.610.21-2.44-2.44-2.20-9.01BSE IT37693.593.172.612.442.47-11.95BSE Healthcare42859.11-1.16-2.15-1.87-2.000.69BSE Power6287.54-1.09-3.32-1.12-2.81-5.23BSE Cons Durables60003.35-1.4-0.00-2.43-0.85-0.77

Markets Today | Central Bank of India Q3 results; strong earnings report

Central Bank of India reported a strong December-quarter performance, with net profit rising 31.6 percent year-on-year to Rs 1,262 crore, compared with Rs 959 crore a year ago. Net interest income was largely flat, easing 1 percent to Rs 3,503 crore from Rs 3,540 crore YoY. Asset quality improved sequentially, with gross NPA declining to 2.70 percent from 3.01 percent QoQ, while net NPA eased to 0.45 percent from 0.48 percent. In absolute terms, gross NPAs fell to Rs 8,726 crore from Rs 8,827 crore QoQ, while net NPAs stood at Rs 1,413 crore, compared with Rs 1,366 crore in the previous quarter. Other income jumped sharply to Rs 1,935 crore from Rs 1,229 crore YoY. The stock was trading 2.1 percent higher at Rs 39.10 in late trade.

Markets Today | Broader indices mixed; banks outperform, smallcaps lag

Outside the frontline benchmarks, market performance was uneven in late trade. Banking indices continued to outperform, with the Nifty Bank at 60,013, up 0.73 percent, and the BSE Bankex rising 0.97 percent to 67,833, extending their strong one-year gains of over 21 percent.

In the broader market, the Nifty Midcap 100 was at 59,875, up 0.18 percent, while the BSE Midcap index edged up 0.14 percent to 46,178. Smallcaps underperformed, with the Nifty Smallcap 100 down 0.24 percent at 17,369 and the BSE Smallcap index slipping 0.29 percent to 49,783, reflecting sustained pressure in the broader space despite relative resilience in banking stocks.

Markets Today | Benchmarks Sensex, Nifty give up gains

The Nifty 50 slipped to 25,680.9, up just 15 points or 0.06 percent, effectively erasing nearly all gains for the day and trading about 190 points below its intraday high. The Sensex was at 83,542.66, up 160 points or 0.19 percent, but had given up most of its earlier gains, sitting nearly 600 points off the day’s high as late-session selling weighed on the market.

Markets Today | IT stocks surge up to 6% on strong Infosys Q3

The shares of IT companies jumped in trade on January 16 as strong Q3 earnings of Infosys boosted investor sentiment. The Nifty IT index jumped more than 3 percent to 39,099.95, emerging as the top sectoral gainer on the market today. The index which was the worst performing sector in 2025, has now recorded the sharpest gains in three weeks. Axis Securities remained ‘cautiously optimistic’ for the Indian IT sector. (Read Full Story)

Makets Today | IT, PSU banks outperform; pharma, metals drag

Sectoral trends were mixed in late trade, with Nifty IT leading gains, up 3.1 percent on the day, even as it remained down nearly 10 percent over the past one year. Nifty PSU Bank also outperformed, rising 0.8 percent, and continues to post strong one-year gains of over 42 percent. On the downside, Nifty Pharma slipped 1.1 percent, while Nifty Metal fell 0.6 percent and Nifty Energy dropped 0.8 percent. FMCG and media stocks also remained under pressure, reflecting continued sectoral divergence despite broader market resilience.

Markets Today | NSE key sectoral indices performance today

NSE Indian Indices PerformanceIndexCMPChg(%)YTD(%)1 Week(%)1 Month(%)1 Year(%)NIFTY Auto27674.45-0.17-1.83-1.470.4821.05NIFTY IT38996.103.12.942.552.45-9.71NIFTY Pharma22257.10-1.1-2.05-2.21-1.481.59NIFTY FMCG52220.45-0.07-5.87-0.42-4.82-5.47NIFTY PSU Bank8982.350.85.264.439.3842.41NIFTY Metal11589.45-0.623.784.4610.7537.61NIFTY Realty855.350.62-2.57-2.13-2.22-7.73NIFTY Energy34345.95-0.8-2.77-0.18-1.220.21NIFTY Infra9251.35-0.08-3.80-0.56-2.7111.44NIFTY Media1408.50-0.49-2.51-1.18-1.89-17.08

Markets Today | Leela Palaces Q3 results: Strong earnings report

The Leela Palaces, Hotels and Resorts reported a strong set of October-December quarter numbers, with net profit jumping to Rs 148 crore from Rs 56.4 crore a year ago. Revenue grew 23.5 percent year-on-year to Rs 457.4 crore, while EBITDA rose 27.2 percent to Rs 238 crore. Operating performance improved further, with EBITDA margin expanding to 52 percent from 50.5 percent in the year-ago quarter.

Markets Today | Nifty dragged lower by banks, defensives

Selling pressure in select heavyweights continued to weigh on the Nifty, with financials and defensives emerging as the biggest drags on the index. ICICI Bank was the single largest negative contributor despite a modest decline, followed by Bharat Electronics and ITC. Among other notable laggards, Maruti Suzuki, Sun Pharma, and HDFC Life Insurance also exerted pressure on the benchmark. Weakness in Cipla and Hindalco added to the drag, while marginal declines in Reliance Industries and Axis Bank further capped gains in the index.

Markets Today | Nifty 50 Index negative contributors

Markets Today | Market breadth turns mixed; declines outnumber advances on NSE

Market breadth weakened in late trade, even as headline indices remained marginally higher. The Nifty 50 was up 36.8 points, or 0.14 percent, at 25,702.4, with 24 stocks advancing and 26 declining. The broader Nifty 500 edged up 0.05 percent to 23,488.7, but declines (288 stocks) outweighed advances (210 stocks), pointing to fading momentum beneath the surface.

Markets Today | Nifty 50, Nifty 500 Advance-Decline (Intra-Day)

Advance/Decline (Intra-day)NIFTY 50;25,697.431.8(0.12%)2426

Advance/Decline (Intra-day)NIFTY 500;23,495.920.05(0.09%)210288

Markets Today | Why Sensex, Nifty erased day's gains

With markets rising strongly after two-day fall, a mild intraday profit booking was seen on the indices with investors awaiting further cues from Q3 results of Reliance Industries, ICICI Bank, HDFC Bank. RIL results will be announced in post-market hours of January 16 while ICICI Bank and HDFC Bank results will be out on January 17. Bank Nifty also saw mild profit booking as it fell below the 60,000-level after reclaiming the milestone after four days.

Sensex falls 550 pts from day's high, Nifty near 25,700: Profit booking, other key reasons behind markets trimming gains

Investors are awaiting further market cues from Q3 results of RIL, ICICI Bank, HDFC Bank...Read More

Markets Today | Benchmarks pare gains further; Sensex, Nifty off day’s highs

Indian equity benchmarks slipped further from their intraday peaks in afternoon trade while remaining in positive territory. The Sensex was at 83,618.14, up 235 points or 0.28 percent, but around 500 points off the day’s high. The Nifty traded at 25,714.15, up 48.55 points or 0.19 percent, having shed about 160 points from its intraday high, signalling some profit-taking after a strong morning run-up.

SEBI chief says NOC for NSE IPO likely later this month, IFCI shares rise 10%; here's why

IFCI's effective stake in NSE through SHCIL is valued at around Rs 13,000 crore ...Read More

Markets Today | Bharat Forge bags defence order; stock up

Bharat Forge shares traded higher after the company announced it has secured an order worth Rs 300 crore under emergency procurement for indigenous unmanned systems. The stock was up 1.05 percent at Rs 1,462.40 in intraday trade.

Markets Today | Midcaps, smallcaps mixed; broader indices steady

Broader markets were mixed, with the Nifty Midcap 100 at 60,121.45, up 0.59 percent, while the Nifty Smallcap 100 was at 17,411.25, flat on the day. The Nifty Next 50 traded at 69,006.05, up 0.32 percent, extending modest gains.

Markets Today | Sensex, Nifty hold gains; Bank Nifty outperforms

Benchmarks indices remained in the green on Friday, with banking stocks lending support. The Sensex was at 83,759.66, up 0.45 percent, while the Nifty was near 25,760, up 0.37 percent. The Bank Nifty outperformed at 60,033.15, up 0.76 percent, and is up 21.82 percent over the past one year.

SEBI chief pushes back on exit-only IPO narrative, cites moderation in OFS share

According to SEBI data cited by the chairman, OFS accounted for about 55 percent of IPO proceeds in 2025, while 45 percent came through fresh issues. In contrast, SME IPOs remain largely growth-oriented, with around 75 percent of funds raised through fresh issuance, he said. ...Read More

Markets Today | NSE largecap stocks that hit 52-week highs today

Select Nifty Next 50 stocks also scaled fresh 52-week highs in intraday trade on Friday, indicating sustained buying interest beyond the frontline index. Punjab National Bank touched a new one-year high of Rs 132.79, while Vedanta climbed to a 52-week high of Rs 686. Bank of Baroda also featured among the gainers, with Bank of Baroda hitting a fresh 52-week high of Rs 313.35 during the session.

Markets Today | Nifty 50 stocks that hit 52-week highs today

Three Nifty 50 stocks touched fresh 52-week highs in intraday trade on Friday, reflecting continued buying interest in select large caps. State Bank of India hit a new one-year high of Rs 1,047.45, while Tata Steel scaled a 52-week high of Rs 191. Axis Bank also joined the list, with Axis Bank touching a fresh 52-week high of Rs 1,309 during the session.

Markets Today | Nifty 50 Market Map

Markets Today | Federal Bank Q3 results: Asset quality improves

Federal Bank’s asset quality improved sequentially in the December quarter, with gross NPA declining to 1.72 percent from 1.83 percent QoQ and net NPA easing to 0.42 percent from 0.48 percent. In absolute terms, gross NPAs fell to Rs 4,447 crore from Rs 4,532 crore QoQ, while net NPAs declined to Rs 1,068 crore from Rs 1,165 crore. Provisions stood at Rs 332 crore, lower than Rs 363 crore in the previous quarter but higher than Rs 292 crore a year ago.

Markets Today | Federal Bank Q3 results: Net profit beats estimates

Federal Bank reported a better-than-expected set of December-quarter results, with net profit rising 9 percent year-on-year to Rs 1,041 crore, beating the CNBC-TV18 poll estimate of Rs 1,000 crore. Net interest income also grew 9 percent on-year to Rs 2,653 crore, ahead of the Street estimate of Rs 2,563 crore.

Markets Today | Sensex, Nifty continue to trade firm

Indian equity benchmarks continued to trade firmly higher around noon, holding on to most of their morning gains. The Sensex was up 476 points, or 0.57 percent, at 83,859, while the Nifty rose 125 points, or 0.49 percent, to 25,790. Market breadth remained positive, with advances continuing to outnumber declines, even as indices stayed off their intraday highs.

Sensex Today | Sterling and Wilson Renewable Energy's reports losses in Q3

#1 Loss stands at Rs 2.8 crore Vs profit of Rs 14.83 crore, YoY

#2 Revenue increases 13.9 percent to Rs 2,092.2 crore Vs Rs 1,837.2 crore, YoY

Sterling and Wilson Renewable Energy was quoting at Rs 217.20, up Rs 19.05, or 9.61 percent.

It has touched an intraday high of Rs 223.60 and an intraday low of Rs 195.00.

It was trading with volumes of 719,125 shares, compared to its five day average of 40,859 shares, an increase of 1,660.00 percent.

It has touched an intraday high of Rs 293.00 and an intraday low of Rs 260.00.

The company approved the appointment of Mr. Sachin Sahay as Chief Executive Officer of Birla Opus Paints, and as Senior Management Personnel of the Company effective 16th February 2026.

Sensex Today | Ahluwalia Contracts secures order of Rs 3069.70 crore

Ahluwalia Contracts (India) Limited has secured an order of Rs 3069.70 crore from Central Public Work Department, New Delhi for construction of common central secretarial building 8 & 9 Plot No. 23 B &C Maulana Azad Road, New Delhi - EPC Projects.

Markets@12 | Sensex, Nifty trade higher

The Sensex was up 436.20 points or 0.52 percent at 83,818.91, and the Nifty was up 108.40 points or 0.42 percent at 25,774. About 2034 shares advanced, 1628 shares declined, and 165 shares unchanged.

Sensex Today | HDFC Bank, ICICI Bank, IDBI Bank, RBL Bank, Yes Bank, among others to announce earnings tomorrow

HDFC Bank, ICICI Bank, IDBI Bank, RBL Bank, Yes Bank, UCO Bank, Can Fin Homes, JK Cement, Netweb Technologies India, PNB Gilts, Punjab & Sind Bank, and Rossari Biotech will announce their quarterly earnings on January 17.

Sensex Today | Reliance Industries, Wipro, Tech Mahindra, Tata Technologies, among others to declare earnings today

Reliance Industries, Wipro, Tech Mahindra, Tata Technologies, Bajaj Healthcare, Central Bank of India, Federal Bank, Geojit Financial Services, JB Chemicals & Pharmaceuticals, Jindal Saw, JSW Infrastructure, Kesoram Industries, L&T Finance, Polycab India, Poonawalla Fincorp, Sobha, and Leela Palaces Hotels & Resorts will release their quarterly results today.

The Board has appointed Vikas Chadha as the Global Chief Executive Officer of the company, effective January 22.

TVS Supply Chain Solutions was quoting at Rs 104.55, down Rs 1.05, or 0.99 percent.

It has touched an intraday high of Rs 105.70 and an intraday low of Rs 104.50.

Sensex Today | NITCO appoints Bikash Jain as CFO

The Board approved the appointment of Bikash Jain as Chief Financial Officer and designated him as a Key Managerial Personnel of the company, effective January 16.

Nitco was quoting at Rs 90.23, up Rs 0.72, or 0.80 percent.

It has touched an intraday high of Rs 91.85 and an intraday low of Rs 89.91.

It was trading with volumes of 39,685 shares, compared to its five day average of 247,964 shares, a decrease of -84.00 percent.

Tuhin Kanta Pandey, Chairman, SEBI

There was an excessive nature of very length disclosures, and now the people are wanting to see how quickly they can grasp it.

And we have heard their voice. For example, in case of IPOs, we will have a draft, abridged prospectus, whenever the IPOs are issued, and there will be a QR code, we can access it in all these advertisements.

We have a whole range of measures to help companies raise capital, we have different kinds of markets, and we have different types of risks which are associated with the market.

Q3 results impact: Angel One shares jump 9% on strong sequential performance; Groww rises up to 9%

Angel One shares rose after the company reported an 11 percent sequential increase in revenue. ...Read More

Sensex Today | Godrej Properties' booking value rises 19%

The booking value grew 19% year-on-year to Rs 34,171 crore in 2025, while collections for the year increased 28% to Rs 18,979 crore.

Godrej Properties was quoting at Rs 1,905.65, up Rs 34.00, or 1.82 percent.

It has touched an intraday high of Rs 1,939.80 and an intraday low of Rs 1,882.

It was trading with volumes of 28,376 shares, compared to its five day average of 31,774 shares, a decrease of -10.70 percent.

In the previous trading session, the share closed down 0.43 percent or Rs 8.15 at Rs 1,871.65.

Sensex Today | BHEL starts supplying of semi-high-speed underslung traction transformers

The company has commenced the supply of semi-high-speed underslung traction transformers for the Vande Bharat Sleeper Train project being executed by a BHEL-led consortium with TRSL.

Bharat Heavy Electricals was quoting at Rs 268.30, up Rs 0.65, or 0.24 percent.

It has touched an intraday high of Rs 269.80 and an intraday low of Rs 266.35.

It was trading with volumes of 264,881 shares, compared to its five day average of 2,051,952 shares, a decrease of -87.09 percent.

Tuhin Kanta Pandey, Chairman, SEBI

FPIs decisions are contingent on how they look at different markets and returns, and also look at earnings growth, currencies and geopolitical factors.

And yes, there has been around 18 billion outflows over the area. But it also depends upon cyclical factors.

So on regulations, we can only see try 2 things. One is making our markets deeper and more diversified, especially the debt markets. The second issue is are there any frictions, which we can improve in the the market? So, one area, which we have really look at it very closely, is the registration process. How we can have registration which is faster, digitising the whole process.

To ease the process we are looking at how we can allow registration to be faster. We've introduced the concept of Swagat, bringing in greater amount of certainty in registration period. And going forward, I think that definitely will also expand digitizing digital signatures.

Ashish Kumar Chauhan, NSE Chief at Samvad 2026

Market participation has become broad-based and inclusive. Around 12.5 crore unique investors now hold more than 14.5 crore accounts across almost all pin codes.

The average investor age is 33 and nearly one in four investors is a woman, and individuals and mutual funds together hold close to 90% of market capitalization, the highest share in over two decades.

This scale marks only the first phase of India’s market evolution. The next phase must focus on institutional maturity, trust, and disciplined, purpose-driven capital allocation.

To sustain long-term growth of around 8% in real terms, India’s investment rate must rise from 30% to 35% of GDP, with a larger role for equity and debt markets alongside bank credit, and deeper participation from startups, MSMEs, and enterprises from tier-2 and tier-3 cities.
